Title: Software Development Engineer (Service Now) - Costco Travel

About the job
    


This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture! The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. Recently Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals.

The value Costco and Costco Travel puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and the Motley Fool. Our employees and our members come FIRST.
Costco Travel is a fast growing subsidiary of Costco Wholesale, and provides leisure travel to millions of Costco members throughout North America.
At Costco Travel, every job is important and every employee is greatly valued. Our own employees are on record as enjoying a fast-paced environment, great co-workers, tremendous growth potential, and excellent benefits. Come enjoy the PERKS of working at a travel company with the BEST culture.
Costco Travel is looking for creative, SMALL TEAM oriented, and motivated engineers who wish to be a FULL STACK developer and a critical member on the development of current and upcoming projects and enhancements to our ecommerce portal. This will include both internal and online applications and will involve the development, enhancement and maintenance of reservation software and creation of vendor specific connections via web services for product availability, pricing and reservations.
Costco Travel is a FULL STACK, fast paced, growing and exciting environment. Our ideal candidate enjoys challenges, appreciates being able to apply creative thinking to solve complex business problems and wants to be part of a small team that is goal focused and results oriented.
If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined.

JD:
About the job
    


          This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture! The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. Recently Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals.

"We wish you were here..."

This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco Travel’s success is its culture. The value Costco and Costco Travel puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and the Motley Fool. Our employees and our members come FIRST.

Costco Travel is a fast growing subsidiary of Costco Wholesale, and provides leisure travel to millions of Costco members throughout North America.

At Costco Travel, every job is important and every employee is greatly valued. Our own employees are on record as enjoying a fast-paced environment, great co-workers, tremendous growth potential, and excellent benefits. Come enjoy the PERKS of working at a travel company with the BEST culture.

Costco Travel is looking for creative, SMALL TEAM oriented, and motivated engineers who wish to be a FULL STACK developer and a critical member on the development of current and upcoming projects and enhancements to our ecommerce portal. This will include both internal and online applications and will involve the development, enhancement and maintenance of reservation software and creation of vendor specific connections via web services for product availability, pricing and reservations.

Costco Travel is a FULL STACK, fast paced, growing and exciting environment. Our ideal candidate enjoys challenges, appreciates being able to apply creative thinking to solve complex business problems and wants to be part of a small team that is goal focused and results oriented.

If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined.

 ROLE 
 Responsible for design and development of next generation Java-based external and in-house travel booking applications  Develop and implement enhancements to make the sales floor more efficient  Efficiently work within the defined development processes and SDLC  Take part in the design discussions and update data models  Make changes to the framework files on a need-basis 
Required
 3 + years of current commercial experience developing with core Java technologies and libraries  3 + years of current commercial experience with design and development of web based applications  2 + years of experience with Java EE technologies (Servlet & JSP)  2 + years of experience with JDBC or equivalent data-tier framework, database design & development  2 + years of experience with SDLC frameworks & IT best practices  3 + years of current commercial experience with relational databases (preferably MS-SQL Server and T-SQL)   Recommended 
 Able to easily shift focus with changing priorities  Must be able to work independently and be forward thinking  Team oriented and capable of working in a small group  Must be motivated and a quick learner capable of multi-tasking  Familiarity or experience with the travel industry a plus 
Required Documents
 Cover Letter  Resume 
California applicants, please click to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice.

Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

Title: Software Development Engineer in Test - SDET/STE - Costco Travel
JD:
About the job
    


          This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals.

Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”.

 Costco Travel is seeking a Senior Software Design Engineer in Test (SDET) to join our Engineering Productivity Team. This role will be responsible for designing and architecting security frameworks, infrastructure, and tools to support the diverse quality organization. The ideal candidate will be a technical leader with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, who work collaboratively with the scrum teams to assure the highest member service experience. 

If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined.

 ROLE 
 Designs, develops, and executes manual/automated software test strategies, plans, and test cases.  Designs code and documents automated test cases within the defined framework to satisfy business requirements and client/project expectations using primarily Selenium with Java.  Analyzes and determines test dependencies including QA environment, QA tools, training, build and deployment plans, and communication processes.  Participates in requirement gathering sessions and give input on requirement and design documents.  Develops and communicates accurate estimates based on testing dependency analysis as requested by the project/management team.  Works closely with the development team on test results and testing required code changes.  Executes automated test scripts; researches test run failures; documents, tracks, and reports defects and results.  Troubleshoots test runs and environments; identifies and resolves problems, often anticipating issues before they occur or before they grow; develops and evaluates options and implements solutions.  Analyzes and manages test results to identify defects, ensures features and user stories work as expected and recommends corrective action as appropriate.  Develops and ensures adherence to standardized software quality assurance best practices, policies, and processes. 
Required
 More than 5 years’ in QA domain designing, developing, and executing manual/automated tests.  More than 3 years’ of experience creating effective robust UI automation testing using Selenium or similar.  Minimum of 5 years’ of progressive, hands-on software quality assurance experience, functional and back-end testing of websites, and back-end applications.  Minimum 4 years’ of hands-on experience using industry standard software QA tools.  A sound understanding of Quality processes and methodologies and their purpose and place within the SDLC.  Must have current design and development experience in Java or similar.  Knowledge and understanding of typical multi-tier application architecture (presentation, service, data).  Well-rounded computer science engineering skills or equivalent experience.  Solid experience with Microsoft SQL or similar relational database.  Knowledge of web-based SOAP/RESTful services.   Recommended 
 Experience working in a Scrum/Agile environment.  Appreciation for CI/CD and DevOps.  Building/maintaining automated test infrastructure.  Development of test tools.  Proficiency in any of the following tools: TFS, IntelliJ, Maven, Git, Junit, Jenkins, Splunk, SOAPUI.  Tomcat/Apache/IIS knowledge.  Self-driven and continuous learning mindset.  Inventive problem solver – open minded but practical.  Travel industry knowledge.  Detail-oriented and capable of working in an environment with changing priorities.  Ability to work within a team environment.  Strong organizational skills.  Analytical thinker possessing strong problem solving and decision-making skills. 
Required Documents
Cover LetterResume
California applicants, please click to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice.

Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.
